chat.msg: hola, q tal? ready to go?
hi
great, we’re starting at the twig near the small island with the tiger, yeah? what's next, mate?
go down under the tiger to the macaw
dodged the tiger, mate
en la isla grande con el loro ahora. ¿En qué dirección desde aquí?
por debajo a la rana
paso a paso, pasando por las tres rocas hacia la rana
what do we do next?
continue to the frog
made it to the frog! now what?
go left stay on the island and cross the crocodile
alright, i've passed the croc
¿Adónde debería dirigirme ahora?
continue going on the big black rock to the grey rock to the giraffe
i see the giraffe towering over
what's next chief?
then go under the giraffe to cross the island to the snake
i'm at the snake now
¿hacia dónde ahora?
once u pass the snake go to the treasure
you have made it
aaaand here we are, the treasure! *finished* good teamwork, mate!
indeed, mate! wouldn't have made it without your splendid instructions
¿Listo para otra ronda o llamarlo juego?
hi there, empezamos?
im here
great! ok from where we are, let's start by stepping left towards that wooden bench but don't get too comfy, we're not stopping yet
adelante y cruce el sendero en dirección oeste.
go down to the next land
just right, next we're making a major u-turn, back across the trail
it's like we're heading towards the dog we started at. let's go!
i would go to the log south where the picnic area is with the dog
¡perfecto! Cruza ese tronco, saluda a nuestro amigo canino al pasar y sigue bajando.
then go through the picnic area to the log on the far left
yep! don't forget to touch the bowl of berries as you pass by
now, head west
ok i touched the berries
awesome! now, head north and cross the river on the wooden branch
no te caigas, ¿vale?
yea i headed to the north
great! now we have a green bush ahead, let's give it some space
walk around it from the right side
yea that is a good idea
nice, glad you think so
ahora dirígete hacia el puesto de floristería
we should past the cyclist
perfect, now let's swerve left, under that florist stand
can you see the big bridge ahead? we're heading there!
yea im on the bridge i passed the bicyclist
awesome, cross that bridge and say hello to the two elderly folks on the bench
sigue un poco mas
yea i am right near the people on the bench
super! now, from there, step down a bit, between them and that next wooden branch
yea we have gone on the to that branch
just right! now see that green bush near the end of the branch? we're heading there!
ok yea im there too
great! now, glance around the bush and branch
¿Puedes ver un camino hacia el este? ¡vamos a seguir eso!
donde es el camino
the path is right between the branch and the bush, just follow it eastbound
ok i have gone eastbound
perfecto! now keep an eye out for a brown young deer
¡Ese es nuestro próximo punto de parada!
ok i am ready
good! keep walking east until you see that brown young deer
you made it! quite an adventure, right?
yea it was
awesome! i'm glad you enjoyed it
gracias por seguir el juego
hola, q tal? ready to go?
im ready
cool! so, i'm at this north tent
¿A dónde debería dirigirme ahora?
me too lets go down pas the dog to the right
all right, bye-bye furry friend! i'm at the fire now, should i go towards the red mushroom or the blue car?
yea take a left past the mushroom do a u turn on the road towards the south path
gotcha, took the left past the mushroom
Vaya, corredor de velocidad corriendo por el camino sur. ¿Qué sigue, amigo?
yea do the u turn at the car and go south on the path towars the telescope
did the u-turn around the blue car and started heading south
here i am, at the telescope. what's next?
go between the bush and the telescope  get back on the path and go left towards the cabin
okay, negotiating between the bush and the telescope. i'm on the path to the left now
Puedes ver la cabaña desde aquí. y terminó*! ¡Llegamos a la casa! Gracias amigo, hacemos un buen equipo. direcciones impresionantes!
hola, q tal? ready to start?
im ready
awesome! let's head out from these three palms. walk south-west, go under the first one, and push towards the second tree
gira bruscamente a la izquierda antes de llegar al tercero. ve al sur. suena divertido, ¿verdad?
im under the second tree
spot on! see that cute brown puppy? heading in its direction, go a little bit to its left
now, turn right heading south. getting the hang of it?
yea i went under the puppy should we go left on the beach
actually, buddy, you're gonna spot a big rock and a little rock. walk in between them
Verás el océano. ¡Caminemos hacia las olas!
ok im between them
splendid! now you're gonna have a fun encounter, a big red crab
still in the water, turn right and stroll along the big rock. keep heading west
yea im still in the water
great! keep going in the water until you reach a medium rock
Luego está nuestro amigo Sharky. girar bruscamente a la derecha
ok im gonna go see sharky
perfect! now back to dry land
head between the rock and a tricolor ball and then northwards
ok im northwards on the way to the stereo
perfect! now, there'll be a red tent on your left and a speaker on your right
ve justo entre ellos. ¡tómalo suave!
ok im at the tent
great! now just circle around it like you're tracing a rainbow
ok im gonna circile around it
terrific! now head south till you see the sea
pero deténgase justo antes de llegar a él. ¡Verás un kayak rojo!
im near the kayak and the sea
perfect! now take a right and walk along under the kayak
im under the kayak
stupendo! now let's turn right again, head north
Camina por el kayak hasta llegar a un arbusto verde.

general_survey.answer: 10 years. I lived overseas in my youth. My parents were part of the US state department. Venezuela for 1 year, honduras for 2 years, nigeria for two years, taiwan for 5 years, guatemala for 3 years, then back to the united states for high school.

When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? To accommodate people who don't share the same language or language fluency.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? For social reasons; one language feels more appropriate.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I can't think of a word in the current language.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? The word in the other language just fits better.

general_survey.answer: it helped a lot. i am venezuelan but don't speak spanish well
general_survey.question: Any final comments about your partner’s language switching?

general_survey.answer: i speak english more than spanish. i am not fluent even though i am venezuelan
general_survey.question: Any final comments about your language background?
